intro: Doellingeria umbellata f. intercedens, commonly known as the slender false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wet or disturbed habitats, such as meadows and stream banks. It has alternate, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster. This fern-like plant is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
